Reviews.Title: “Good place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Majia
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. I was visiting a friend who was at a hospice home and this was a very convenient location for me. The rooms I thought were well decorated and comfortable. The check in staff were so welcoming and accomodating. The price was right and I appreciated the full breakfast offered. Also the noise in between the rooms was fairly quiet which is always a big plus. Unfortunately I didn't sleep well here on one of the nights I stayed because of the rude loud guests and kids outside of the room at all hours of the night. Also the staff person that checked me out when I left was really rude. It's too bad because all in all my stay was a good one and this encounter left a sour taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: katieb4m
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room online for 2 queen beds. We checked in late and they gave us a room with one queen. I went and told her that we reserved 2 beds. She showed me the online reservation and it said 1 bed. I showed her my email that said 2 beds. She did however give us a discount and a room with 2 beds :) The rooms were nice and clean. The pool was wonderful. The staff was friendly. Great breakfast. This hotel was amazing clean! When we got home we checked out account and not only did they charge us one fee but they charged us 2! One for $78 and one for $104. When I called they said that the $104 was a hold and because it was the weekend it would release Tuesday at midnight. Well that was not true cause it cleared out bank. They did however credit that back to our account which took 2 days. Causing us to go neg in our bank. But our bank reversed the NSF funds So just double check that if you reserve online.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the north side of Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Buzzhombre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by I-17 on Northern Ave. It's a three story property with lots of nicely appointed rooms with all the usual features. The staff is friendly and efficient and the rates are good. The breakfast room is large, but the serving area is very cramped--being arranged in a U-shape which always creates problems. Someone waiting for toast can block access to several other items. In addition, they have a TV blaring in the breakfast room which you can't get away from. They do have a good selection of breakfast items, however. The hotel also has a guest laundry, which you have to access with a room key obtained at the front desk, making it very secure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, excellent staff, and good value.”
Reviews.Author: CdnWandererPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on Tripadvisor reviews, location, and price. Staff was very courteous and check-in was quick. Room was clean expect for some mold spots in the textured plaster ceiling above the bathtub. Good continental breakfast including the usual items plus eggs and sausage. The hotel is located on the north side of phoenix right next to I-17 and one side has rooms accessed from an outside walkway alongside the highway– be sure to ask for a room away from the interstate unless ceaseless road noise doesn't bother you. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Frogman66
Reviews.Content: This was an ok hotel with a reasonable price just beside the highway. We had a room on the pool side and it was a nice, quiet and comfortable room. The hotel has a pool and a hottub and internet access. The breakfast was included and was excellent. The downside of the place is that it's in the middle of nowhere, at least 30 mins away from the airport and nothing really nearby except the busy highway. Anyways, good for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this!”
Reviews.Author: mikey54x
Reviews.Content: I can,t believe that this property has been rated so highly. I am a loyal TripAdvisor user and reviewer and can't fanthom these great reviews. Noisy traffic from highway right next to the hotel. Nice clean rooms but very small with no fridge or microwave.Greeted with stone faced unhelpful desk clerk(Michelle). After this experiance I truly believe that requesting certain things in advance never works! Requested ground floor, no way, requested quietest area, nope! Folks, we made these requests 2 1/2 months iin advance and when you remind them of this they look at you like your nuts. I do believe that the desk clerk could have been more helpful and accomadating in this matter if she wanted to. OK , the rest of the review. Pool is very small and very dirty. Bloody band-aid and coins in the bottom of mirky, dirty pool. Hot tub will fit maybe 2-3 children or 1-2 adults. AC units are unusually loud and annoying. I would recommend this hotel if you are just passing through the Phoenix area and are deaf, staying 1 night. This is no place for people that are staying in one place for awhile and like peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: lenora t
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at your location, we were not happy with the hotel as the rooms were old and needs updating. The room smelled musty and was dark, not much for lighting. The bed was comfortable but the blankets were old! We had booked 3 nights but only stayed one night and moved to another hotel. The breakfast was terrible. The staff member that took my reservation had my first and last name completely wrong, as well my address was incorrectly spelled and postal code totally wrong..luckily I had my confirmation number otherwise we would have been out of luck for getting a room as we had booked this a month prior and it was "Speed weekend" at the Phoenix International Raceway. Would not recommend this hotel. I do like the BW Phoenix InnSuites Hotel which was just 5 miles away. We ended up staying there for the last 2 nights and would defenately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: forsyth85
Reviews.Content: Loved the free access to LA Fitness, only a block away. Super easy to jump on freeway, too. Need to join the 21st century, though, and put in flat-screen TV's.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Fl0renceLee
Reviews.Content: Have many friendly and helpful staff that made my stay there wonderful! It is just next to I-17 so convenient to go anywhere! Have 2 small shopping centres nearby! Only bad thing is during my last 3 nights there, I got bitten by bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, reasonably clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Lorna H
Reviews.Content: Be sure to ask for a room on the side away from the interstate. We stayed here four nights. When we checked in we were told that the rate would be the same reasonable rate for all four nights. When we checked out they had jacked up the price on the last night and wouldn't back down even though we gave them the name of the employee who quoted us the price. "She made a mistake" was the response. Arrgh! The room was clean enough to be comfortable but the toilet was a little smelly and at times I could smell cigarette smoke wafting in through the central AC. Typically this happened in the early morning hours. The AC unit was noisy so we turned it off at night. The room got really cold so we layered on clothes before bedding down. The breakfast was OK. I might stay here again if I can get a guaranteed checkout price. One good thing is that its in a decent neighborhood. I felt safe enough to go out for a power walk every morning at dawn.

Reviews.Title: “If your dream is incessant road noise”
Reviews.Author: r b
Reviews.Content: this is the place for you. Just a few feet from the lovely Black Canyon Freeway, you will not get a wink of sleep. Also be prepared for unannounced charges to your bill, such as the "room safe" fee. The price is low for a reason. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully updated rooms with comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: boss9272
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience! We arrived @ 2:30 am after a delayed flight & was greeted warmly by night staff. Quick check-in into a CLEAN, spacious comfy King executive room facing the beautiful pool area. Room obviously recently beautifully update. Bed was soooo comfortable. Stayed three nights, close to everything with quick & easy off from the Interstate. Hot breakfast provided by the hotel is ample, We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Return Stay”
Reviews.Author: taffy66_10
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel while on vacation last year due to the great value for money.I was not disappointed this year,the general Manager was on the front desk when I checked in.She remembered me from last year and made me feel most welcome. We reminisced about my stay last year when I arrived in one of the worst hailstone storms Phoenix had seen. This year it was raining heavily,I did apologise for bringing the British weather with me again. For great rooms, great location and great staff,stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Julie V
Reviews.Content: Recently rented 3 rooms for 3 nights. Everything was fine with the hotel the first night we were there (with the exception of very noisy neighbors and the intermittantly running air conditioning). The problem arose when we returned for our second night and found that housekeeping skipped 2 of our 3 rooms. We went to the front desk to let them know and to get clean towels, and we were told that we had requested that the rooms not be serviced. Really?? We asked the desk clerk to please be sure to tell housekeeping to clean our rooms the following day. When we returned for our 3rd night, 1 of the rooms was skipped again! We again went to the desk to get towels, coffee, and soap and to speak to the desk clerks. We were told we again had requested that the room not be cleaned. Considering we left before 7am, there was no housekeeping to tell anything as they were not even on the property yet. We were also told we should have brought it to the attention of the front desk staff the first time it happened!!! We told the desk staff that WE DID!!!! Just got the impression that the staff here does not care. Both clerks both nights basically told us we were lying about the rooms not getting cleaned. If housekeeping says that the rooms were not to be serviced, then they are right and we are wrong. Apparently it isn't possible that housekeeping is lying and maybe a bit lazy??

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, convenient and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S
Reviews.Content: It was a one week stay. Other than the change in patron neighbors, this was a good stay. I don't like that they book people right next door when the hotel is not full, just to keep patrons together for efficiency in cleaning...but I understand. Just made for noisy exchanges right next door.

Reviews.Title: “AS ALWAYS HAD A GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: thomas m
Reviews.Content: The Staff,The Breakfast,The Rooms and the cleanliness of the place has improved every year.Thanks to the Owner and Staff at this BEST WESTERN.You'll always be my place to stay when i'm in PHOENIX.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place”
Reviews.Author: 2srbest
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel which has been completely refurbished this past year. Easy off from the Interstate. Our rooms facing the salt-water pool were quite comfortable. A dozen restaurants are in walking distance, but you won't need them for breakfast as the one provided by the hotel is ample,Again we had two great nights of sleep. Hairdryer, TV with HBO, free WI-FI, mini-fridge, and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Tamara M
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the revenues that I read and I'm glad I did. The hotel was very nice and the staff is very friendly. The location was great, it is in the middle of everything. My family enjoyed our stay, the room was clean and the beds very comfortable. we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BamaKathy1951
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Had clean, COMFORTABLE beds. We traveled to Phoenix with a tour group and were assigned a room with two queen beds that were wonderful. The room was clean and attractive. Well appointed with coffee maker and hair dryer. No fridge or microwave. Several restaurants within walking distance. Nice hot breakfast in the a.m. with enough seating for about 30 people to have breakfast in a clean and attractive area. We did not have time this trip to use the pool. Staff was wonderful. We had a couple that were unable to walk to the restaurants due to health concerns, and one of the staff drove the couple to the restaurant and picked them up afterward. I call that extraordinary service. Nice stay. We would stay there again.l

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and knowledgable staff.”
Reviews.Author: hawkspirit
Reviews.Content: Good value for your money and a central location. Hot breakfast available each morning. Guest laundry available.

Reviews.Title: “the best of all the Best Westerns I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: marzinihw
Reviews.Content: we were in phoenix area in late evening so we choose this motel based on the discount booklet we had. at the end, for the price we payd, it was one of the best deal we found in our travel. fast checking, friendly staff, free parking,Wi Fi & wonderful breakfast. Excellent location near the highway if you are just passing by.. Very clean & quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elaine H
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with large comfortable rooms, we had a room at the back and it was very quite, the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable, checking in was quick and easy and the gentleman that booked us in was friendly and helpful, we had a free breakfast and car parking. We picked this hotel as it was in a great spot as we were on a way to Williams and it was easy to find and get to with out any trouble and it was a really great price as well. We arrived late and there was a Denny’s restaurant around the corner, so we were able to have a good meal, we would stay here again as it was really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like the outside corridors in such hot weather”
Reviews.Author: TonyTTA
Reviews.Content: Walking from the lobby or the elevator to any room requuires going outside in the 100+ AZ heat and walking long corridors. Bad design for the climate. Room was nice and clean and the brekafast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: desertjoe
Reviews.Content: We needed a convenient overnight on a long journey and this Best Western was close by the Interstate. It provided a haven to relax after driving through heavy storms. Staff were great, bed was comfortable and our room (top floor at the rear) was nice and quiet. A nice breakfast was available to see us on our way next morning.We'll be back!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca, Argentina
Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: tai55
Reviews.Content: I went to Phoenix Arizona to visit family. I got an excellent deal on this hotel through Expedia. First impressions are always important. When I initially entered Best Western MetroCenter in Phoenix, the front desk was vacant. I looked over the counter to a small room behind the desk and several staff members were chatting away. I waited a minute or two and decided to move over to the right hoping they would notice me. Finally a lady named Lisa greeted me. She was pleasant and checked me in. She than proceeded to explain to me that my card would be charged an additional $25.00 for any room damages that may occur. She made it a point to make sure I have it removed at the time of check out. At check out two days later, a lady named Carrie was attending the front desk. She did not look happy to be there and did not bother asking me how my stay was. I gave her my room cards and she said, "your checked out." I asked her about the $25.00 charge and wanted to make sure it would be removed from my card. She quickly stated that it was never placed on the card. I asked for a receipt for proof of no charge and she stated, "I'm looking at the screen and you did not get charged." She apparently could not give me a receipt. I asked to speak to the manager and she said she was not available. I asked her for her name and when I was writing it down, all she was concerned about was that I spelled her name incorrectly. How UNPROFESSIONAL can you get? I would NEVER stay there again for the mere fact that the staff needs Customer Service 101.

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome stay at The Best Western Metrocenter”
Reviews.Author: TheWeTourUSA
Reviews.Content: On my walking trip across America I have stayed almost exclusively at BW independently owned properties. I find that there is a shared attention to detail and courteous service to be found there and the Metrocenter is no exception. I was greeted by friendly ,knowledgeable staff and was checked in rapidly to a very comfortable room. The amenities here are many and varied and I suggest you look at the list provided. The pool area is well kept and towels are available poolside. The complimentary breakfast was a pleasant surprise as to the extraordinary selection that is provided and fresh hot coffee is available 24 hours a day. The entire staff have taken the time to say hello and ask if there is anything I need. The location is central to all the sights and in my case a very good public transportation system including light rail to shuttle you to the downtown area. All in all my stay is and has been a wonderful experience and I highly recommend travelers stay at this property when in Phoenix. My hat is off to the management from the owners to housekeeping for a job well done !!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stop-over”
Reviews.Author: ThreeLegsIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable ideally located just off I-17. Lovely pool and jacuzzi but basic breakfast. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: mathstud
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The bed was okay. The breakfast was acceptable. The service was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and a really great value”
Reviews.Author: abqtravelermta
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is right off I-17 (the Black Canyon Freeway) and Northern Avenue with easy access both on and off the freeway. To call the location "Metrocenter" is a bit of a stretch as the Metrocenter Complex is at least one mile (if not more) north of the hotel, but it's an easy drive by car via the frontage road. Years ago this hotel was a first-generation Hampton Inn and all the rooms are accessed via outdoor corridors rather than the favored indoor hallways. If you want quiet be sure to get a room by the pool; other rooms, especially those facing the freeway, are going to be a bit noisier. (Although, during warmer months when the pool is getting heavy use the rooms facing the freeway may be quieter.) My experience was quite positive; my plane arrived well before Noon and when I called the hotel and asked to check-in early I was told, "Come on over! I'll find you a room!" (Truth be told, the hotel wasn't very busy that weekend; it was Thanksgiving.) The front desk had my reservation in order upon arrival; one signature and I was on my way to my room. I seem to recall paying about $65 a night and got a clean room overlooking the pool. They trumpet their "housekeeping awards" on their website and I will allow that my room was very, very clean. (The bathroom, while clean, was a bit dated.) My sister was staying in another room and she remarked how clean her room was, and my sister is very, very picky. There were plenty of towels, soap and shampoo. The front desk staff was friendly at check-in and check-out. The business center in the lobby worked fine. The outdoor pool and hot tub were both clean and operational, but it was really too cold for either. I only stayed one night so I am not qualified to comment about on-going housekeeping, but my sister (who stayed 4 nights) reported a sparkling clean room with piles of fresh towels on a daily basis. (And yes, we do tip the housekeeping staff so that may have had something to do with it.) I wanted a clean, comfortable room at a reasonable price and I got it. For the purposes of this particular trip this hotel and this location worked well for me and I'm happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Ch_Pat
Reviews.Content: It is difficult and v expensive to get rooms in Phoenix during the March Madness. I got a good deal for 3 nights and thats how i landed up at this hotel. First things first - the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The Front Office Staff was very cheerful and friendly even in all their haste. So was the maintenance staff. We had a problem with a noisy AC in our room. The maint staff was on it within 5- 10 min on call. They tried to repair it nd when it was not posible - simply replaced it immediately. You might spy housekeeping staff smoking on the hallways next to the cart through your window - but never in front of guests. The pool and spa, though i never used it - looked clean, and also popular. Of course with people, alos comes smoking, some drinking and noise. The stay is a no frills experience. Clean decent rooms. Clean bed and clean bathroom. The carpets might be smightly worn out and not too plush and so would the towels be - but they are clean and very much in acceptable state. Breakfast is excellent and wholesome - and much better than what you get in many other hotels. There are couple of mexican restaurants right next - so lunch and dinner is also quite comfortable. About the location - its right off the freeway. VEry close to airport and a lot of other places in Phoenix. It worked well for me as it was close to my office. I did find some street people and some people peddling stuff on the streets, but somehow the area didnt make me feel too insecure or scared. Overall - i would recommend the hotel - if youa re looking for a good stay with economical budget in a "close to most things" location.

Reviews.Title: “Quality accomdations, close to everything, but very busy.”
Reviews.Author: gr8fulspace
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its logistics. We had a couple of places we wanted to visit in the Phoenix area and this hotel was perfectly situated on I-17. Best Western is a chain I feel I can count on for being clean and affordable, just as this one was. There are plenty of restaurants all around the hotel, some within walking distance. There were only two things that dropped my rating from excellent to very good: the maids kept taking away the soap and not putting any back and there was quite a bit of noise due to how busy the hotel was. Also, the room did not have a refrigerator nor a microwave, so don't bring any snacks with you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 2srbest
Reviews.Content: The main reason for the "wow!" is that we only payed $10 more for room, the clerk said would have a microwave, fridge, and pillowtop bed. The bed proved to be a King rather than a double and the spacious room faced away from the freeway. Coffees in the room, decaf as well as regular were flavorful and fragrant (better than the coffee in the lobby). Breakfast included waffles you made yourself. No, the spa still doesn't work. But the pool does.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....close to all parts of Phoenix area”
Reviews.Author: LWK311
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in February for 4 nights. Check in was pleasant, staff very helpful. Rooms were clean but could use a bit of renovation. Beds were very comfortable. Very quiet, had a good sleep each night. Overall, the hotel was good for what we paid. Would stay there again. Recommend it to anyone traveling to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: ponygaltoo
Reviews.Content: Great front of house staff greeted us, breakfast buffet was plentiful (could definitely use another waffle maker - only have one), rooms were clean as were the grounds. Good location right off the I-17 with a Denny's and Marie Calendars Restaurant close by. Lounge chairs by the pool need to be replaced as most have bottoms broken out, but that's a minor detail. Overall a well run facility.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are the best.”
Reviews.Author: purpleadam
Reviews.Content: I wrote a previous review but it got lost during transmission. My comments were about the employees of the Best Western Metrocenter who had to deal with a poorly planned trip through YMT Vacations. The company did not notify the hotel that there would be two busses, not one arriving on October 18th. The staff did a commendable job of arranging rooms, stowing luggage and setteling in an entire bus load of unexpected guests. They never lost their sense of humor and were great throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JoseeH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western from October 9th through 16th... We were two sisters from Montreal, Quebec, Canada who visited family. Very convenient to travel and visit any tourist attractions. Check in and out was done with a smile. Our room was clean and beds were very comfortable. One think I notice, even if all rooms were booked, our room was soundproof and hotel was very quiet. Everytime we had a request, it was taken care. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel anytime...On our next trip, we will book again..Thank you to all the personnel of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Value!”
Reviews.Author: samuelesparza
Reviews.Content: I have worked for an upscale hotel chain and, I'm spoiled when it comes to quality. This motel was as clean if not cleaner than any 4-star hotels we've stayed in. The free breakfast buffet was excellent, beautifully arranged and stocked. The staff was very nice and attentive, thanks to Lisa we had a very smooth check-in & out. The beds were a bit too soft for me but, the rooms were clean and nice. Great job MetroCenter!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and inexpensive!”
Reviews.Author: MsAdventure7
Reviews.Content: We were traveling through the area and stayed at this location. We opted for the deluxe package for a minimal charge. It came with pillow top beds, a microwave and a fridge. Very comfortable and clean. The salt water pool was excellent! The hot breakfast included eggs, waffels and biscuts with gravy...yummy! I would definitly recommend this location. Great bang for your buck!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel For the Price!!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaLA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! The continental breakfast was excellent but typical - muffins, bacon, eggs, toast, waffles, juice, coffee etc... The staff was very friendly! The free wifi in the room was very fast and reliable with my iPod and even reached to the pool area. It was great to have access to a free printer and desktop computer at front to use but no USB connection so bring your own if you need that kind of device. Ordered pizza from a nice the location advertised in the guide book and it was very good quality. The pool area was clean and the water was warm. The bed was very comfortable and there was no noise at night even though it was next to the highway. The view from the room was really nice and you might even catch a nice sunset if you walk around the balcony outside! AT tht end of my stay I asked to remove the safety fee and the price for 3 nights was very reasonable! The selection of TV channels was more than enough though the reception was a bit fuzzy. My only complaint was the lighting in the room. There was no overhead light - just a few lamps to light up the room. The other minor issue was the location - there wasn't much around the area to go see or do other than a K-Mart. Otherwise I really loved my stay - Great hotel, food and staff - I highly recommend booking - don't let the great price fool you - it's worth every penny! I even got some nice Arizona sunset and mountain pictures right from the hotel balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop off on the way to the Grand Canyon”
Reviews.Author: freddo56
Reviews.Content: Lovely motel. Nice surprise. Beautifully appointed room, spacious, overlooking pool. Great breakfast included. Close to highway but no road noise. Cafes close by.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: singingwulf
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Dont was your money. If you like Drunk loud people this is your place. One thing after another was wrong. First of all wanted a room with 2 queen beds. Called and made reservations. They dont have queen beds. Only 2 doubles. Ok give me two ajoining rooms. None are available. Your 10 year old can stay in a room by herself and you and your wife can stay down the hall. Not on your life I told them. Finally they come up with 2 rooms side by side. My wife stays with our daughter and I get the other room. A/C makes a screeching load noise and cuts out every 10 min. Thats when you can hear the drunk people screaming at each other. This went on and on. Never will I stay here again. Still waiting for the manager to call me back.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: smith6464
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty old and tired - the beds were old and soft.. Breakfast was good. Price was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Bring your own pillow!!!”
Reviews.Author: agonzalez1112
Reviews.Content: The location is really good. It was close to a lot of food (our favorite was Del Taco right down the road). It is w/in walking distance to Denny's, Burger King, Marie Calendars, and more. Real close to multiple shopping centers. The hotel is only one exit away from Castles N Coasters. The room is old, but clean. We got the king, executive room, which has the pillowtop bed. The bed is really comfortable. The pillows are horrible. They are about half the length of a normal pillow and are filled with some kind of pellets. We stayed 2 nights and my neck was killing me. Thankfully, my 7 year old son was able to sleep w/o a pillow, so wasn't affected. The pool area was real clean and nice. The breakfast was better than most. There was a waffle maker, sausage patties, omelete's, bagels, pastries, cereals, biscuits and gravy, etc. I was a little disappointed that they did not have the pay per view movie ordering system that is in a lot of the other Best Western's we have stayed in. I would stay here again due to the low price and location, but I will definitely bring my own pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Live-n-Eat
Reviews.Content: Not only is the location central, but we only paid approx. $50/night and the hotel was like new and very clean. They also have a heated pool and hot tub. We loved it! Great value for the money. Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: desirae7
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and cozy. Pool area is closed at midnight, so it was quiet for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: bravo1950
Reviews.Content: I travel to phoenix regularly and this hotel is a real gem. Excellent staff,very friendly and willing to please. free parking,Wi Fi & breakfast. Excellent location. Very clean & quiet. Good prices especially when booked on the net. Probably the best of all the Best Westerns I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Best Western hotels I've used.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGuy_7
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservations I was not thinking much about the hotel but I was impressed when I walked in and saw the cleanliness of this property. I was greeted promply by the desk staff who also gave me information on the many restaurants located within walking distance. My room was nice and had triple sheeting and free internet access. I didn't get to use the pool although it looked so inviting in the almost 100-degree weather. I was told this hotel just won the Best Western Housekeeping Award and I can see why. Totally recommend it to anyone looking to stay in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ManicCeramic
Reviews.Content: Travelling by myself, single female to another state.... Found it easilly, really great easy on/off with the freeway (which you totally can't hear at night. Its rather pleasant), lots of little stores nearby (Kmart, Circle K, et cetera) and food. Very clean rooms, like? Cleaner than you would expect out of a Best Western. Comfy bed, nice linens, lots of counter space by the sink for your makeup (Ladies you know what I'm saying!). It's spacious, too! I've been in chain hotels before where it's almost claustrophobically small, but this one has a good amount of space in the rooms. Overall just a really great value and not too far from all the stuff you need.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: bobSlipperyRock_pa
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nites paid $50ish a nite, clean room, nice continental breakfast. would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and suprise with the room”
Reviews.Author: Catie8
Reviews.Content: I am really impress with the new ownership and hotel management. They have significant improve the property from my last stay 6 months ago. The rooms are fresh, staff is friendly and most importantly for me was the breakfast. There are many choices and items are replenish frequently to meet the next hungry guest. I would highly recommend this property for anyone coming to town. It is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant No Frills Stay”
Reviews.Author: gooooogirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a no frills stay. $90.00 a day. I stayed in room 143 and was able to park my rental right outside my door every night. The rooms are clean and accommodating and the staff is very friendly. The breakfast included eggs, sausage, make-it-yourself waffles, fruit, muffins and toast, cereal, coffee and juices. I would recommend it for an overnighter. It is centrally located and there is access to the highway, lots of shopping and restaurants. The area isn't so great, but I still felt safe. The major drawback for this property is that the walls are thin and you can easily hear what is going on in the rooms next to you and outside. A pair of foam ear plugs cured that easily. It was just a little noisy, but the fact that it is spring break may have added to the volume...not bad, but a little loud. (Who would go to the Best Western in Phoenix for spring break anyway? I thought that was a little peculiar, but who knows.) I saw no cockroaches, not a single bug while I was here and that is great for this area since it is surrounded by many restaurants, stores etc...Phoenix is notorious for the little buggers! My biggest gripe is that I had to call for housekeeping everyday to have my room made up. I don't get it. I am a frequent guest at Best Western and know that the room incluces housekeeping. Not sure what happened with that.

Reviews.Title: “Gimme A Break...”
Reviews.Author: jmzim
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into this hotel, we found out that "Refridgerator upon request" means, "If you want a room with a King, you'll have to pay extra for that!" Ok, no biggy, I guess... it was just one night, after all. We got to our room, and we were pleasantly surprised with how clean it was. Nice layout, plenty of space, decent channel selection, the bed wasn't too hard... Thought we'd made a good decision, so we left for dinner (with nowhere to put any left-overs)... Since this hotel is right off the busy I-17, we were concerned with the noise factor. Turns out, the freeway noise wasn't noticable from our room! However, we heard every person walking up & down the stairs all night and early the next morning. We heard every door nearby slam. Usually I'd just turn on the fan to cover up that kind of noise, but the A.C. unit in these rooms doesn't have a fan that stays on, it just blows loudly for 5-10 minutes and doesn't come back on for 30 (anybody familiar with this area at all knows that a good A.C. is EXTREMELY important!) At 8 a.m. the landscapers started up with the leaf blowers and lawn mowers. So since I'm up, I'll go to the "Breakfast Buffet" (Ha! Better get there earlier than that if you want something other that stale bagles/muffins and room temp milk & cereal) and then requested a later check-out, hoping that we could eventually get some rest before a long day of driving, but instead it got noisier... After the landscapers left, the hotel decides to pressure wash all of the walkways (powered by a VERY loud air compressor). After accepting that we were not going to get anymore sleep, we did take a nice shower. Pretty sad when the highlight of your stay is a decent shower head... To be fair, we have stayed in worse. But it just seemed to one thing after another. The icing on the cake (since this was a birthday trip, after all...) was when we checked out. Brought up the noise problem to the front desk, and didn't get so much as an appology. "Oh. They're cleaning the floors." Really? Well, thanks for clearing that up! Then we got to the car, parked downstairs from our room, only to find that all the nasty run-off from their floors had splashed all over my newly detailed car. And so I said, "I need to write a review for this place!" You'll read mixed reviews here. I did. That's part of the reason I chose this hotel. The good outwieghed the bad & the price was reasonable... And if you're a heavy sleeper who has to wake up early anyway, and doesn't mind warm nights on stiff sheets, and would basically be happy just to have a roof over your head and a free breakfast (many of us HAVE been there), then you'll really enjoy this place! We normally enjoy staying at Best Western, but I was quite unhappy with this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: LadyLiz
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Best Western Metro Center after the Grand Canyon visit and prior to an early morning flight. The hotel is located more in a business park, but it was quiet, clean and there were some good restaurants nearby. Our check in was friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and generally nice. We felt safe walking around the area. We walked to an upscale Mexican restaurant for dinner. The trouble began when we were getting ready for bed. Without warning, someone unlocked our door and tried to enter. We had the chain on, and yelled out....they still banged at the door trying to gain entry. We slammed the door closed and called the desk. "Oh" was the reply. "Your're not supposed to be in there". Since we'd been assigned the room, given a key, and instructions on where the room was, it didn't make sense. "You should be elsewhere" was the only explanation. We let it slide, until the next morning when we went to breakfast (they had a fair breakfast for guests)....when we returned to our room we were locked out. The key had been changed for the intruder and as far as I know he still had it. We went to the desk and complained, got a new key, and a bland smile. after relating our experience....and were given a weak excuse.....I took their comment card and wrote corporate, who referred it to the manager (who, we learned was the one who checked us in)....and got a "these things happen. Please come again". Not likely! This sort of mistake could cost someone their life....While the hotel is nice, I will not go there again....a sincere apology and an effort to make amends would have made a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: Silex
Reviews.Content: Have usually found Best Westerns to be reliable and this is no exception. Prompt & friendly service, quiet rooms, good facilities (including pool & internet) and nice choice of free breakfast. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good best western”
Reviews.Author: subdev
Reviews.Content: typical best western, nice and clean with decent service. good location with lots of nearby shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the I-17 Metrocenter Inn on a Monday night. There were very few guests that night so believe that there were on a few occupied rooms on each floor. I didn't see any other guests until I went for the included breakfast. Even though the Inn is close to the busy I-17 the room I was in was quiet. Although the room was a bit small it was very clean and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was staying in town on business for a week. I checked in with no problem, the room was nice and clean. After the first night I placed a do not distub sign on the door, because I had valuables in the room. When I came back that evening the DND sign was still on the door and my room was completely made up. Evidently, that sign does not work. I had the same problem the next day, then eventually gave up. I thought the service was terrible during my stay. I never got an answer other then, "I don't know" or "You have to talk to a manager", from the front desk. I asked the front desk one morning where the nearest post office was located. As you can guess the answer was "I don't know." He refused to help me find out or look it up. Come to find out, it is NEXT DOOR!! About 6 nights into my stay they call me and wake me up in the morning asking me who I am, and go on to tell me that they checked me out 2 days ago, and had no idea who was in the room. They then check me back in at a much higher rate. The front desk did not care and told me I would have to talk to a manager. I tried that day, the day after, several phone calls after I left the hotel and never received an answer regarding an all the sudden new higher rate. Upon checkout I realized they were charging me the wrong rate the whole week!! I said when I signed the registration card it said the same rate as when I made the reservation, why do I have a new (almost double) rate? All the front desk said was I have to speak to a manager (evidently the one who is never there or returns my calls/message). Finally, at the end of my stay I was overcharged by $300. I contaced Best Western International and got my money back, but what a hassle. I would not recommend this property to anyone staying in Phoneix. There are too many hotels to stay at, why bother with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place !”
Reviews.Author: Algood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. I am not sure if it is the time of the year or what but we ran into one glitch after another. The first night when we settled into our room, we saw a HUGE cockroach on the wall! I mean huge like the type in Asia. It was disgusting. Called the front desk and the security came up immediately. He came with nothing and tried using the toilet paper to catch it ! And of course, it disappeared. Then he decides to go and get some spray at which point I am ready to walk out in my PJs. They gave us another room which they said was a newly renovated one. Did not look so to me. Early next morning when we tried to use the toilet, there was no water. Then my husband figured that the tap to the toilet was not open. But the toilet water ran once in a while after that making this annoying noise. Probably that is why it was shut off. After returning from a long day of activities, we could not get into the room since our cards were not working (we had two). I had to go to the front desk and activate the cards again. I have had breakfasts in places like La Quinta and Ramada and they are decent. They are not fancy but give a good basic filling one needs to start the day. I was expecting something along that line but it was very disappointing. The toaster was not working. They figured then that the outlet was not working. The sausages and eggs were plugged into that outlet. Therefore, there was no heat on them either, how long, I am not sure (health violation ?). They did not even have any fruits. Other than that, there was the normal items - coffee, juice, cereal, bread and waffle. Close to the highway makes this place easy to get in and out. There are plenty of restaurants around. That said, we will definitely not stay in this place again. The front desk guy told us that the place is being renovated and we got a renovated room. If they call this renovation, I am not sure how it was before. Find another place if you want a more comfortable (healthy) stay.

Reviews.Title: “okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WAhiker
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy and a little run down. It is an okay place to stay, the neighborhood was safe. Okay place to stay if inexpensive ond ony spending the night.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Phoenix I-17 MetroCenter Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 8101 North Black Canyon Highway, Phoenix, AZ 85021
